--From my house on Tuesday, the 30th ult., a colored Girl, named Louisa, owned by Mrs. Mary A. Williamson.
A liberal reward will be paid if returned to me at my shop, or placed where I can get her.

div3.head: Two hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from my house, in Chesterfield, on the 1st day of May last, my woman Sylvia, and her daughter Louisa.
Sylvia is a mulatto; 37 years old; about 5 feet high; stout built, and rather gray for one of her age; she has a husband by the name of Kit, hired in Richmond, and belonging to Thos. Lilbge, of Chesterfield.
Louisa is 14 years old; the color of her mother, and about the same height, spare made, and stoops in the shoulders.
I have reasons to believe they are concealed in Richmond.
I will give the above reward for their apprehension and confinement in any jail, so that I can get them again.

div3.head: Ranaway
div3.p:
--From the subscriber, on or about the 23d November, my negro Boy, Davy, about 16 years old, light brown color, full head of hair, no marks recollected; was sold by W. J. Dickinson, at the auction house of Dickinson & Hill.
in Richmond, and was purchased by H. Raanondeen, of whom I purchased him. A reasonable reward will be paid it taken up and secured in any jail so I get him again, or delivered to me at Bull's Roads, Louisa county, Va.

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from the farm of John W. Adkins, H in the county of Goochland, about the first day of August, a negro Boy, about 17 years of age stoutly built, dark mulatto color; with his forehead.
He is an intelligent-boy, but when spoken to. It is believed that he has gone off with some officer or soldier, and is now the lines of our army.
The above reward will be paid for his apprehension.

div3.head: Three hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway, on 2d July, a negro woman by the name of Winny Morton.
She is about 5 feet 2 inches, high, stout built, and black, with thin lips, chews tobacco, and looks grum; she has relations in Richmond and some in Manchester; she passes as a washerwoman.
She was sold into Absolute slavery by order of the Hustings Court.
She no doubt has her free papers, she reported she lost them, which in Wherever any person comes across a Winny, and she has her free papers, take her up,--I will give the above reward to any white man, or black man, or black woman, let her be slave or free, so that, I am able, to lay my hands upon said Winny, or lodged in any jail.
div3.closer:
J. W. Satterwhite,
Petersburg paper please copy for one month, and send bill to J. W. R., corner of Franklin and 18th sis. no 18--1m*

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from the subscriber, about the 1st of November last, my negro man Charles.
The above reward will be paid to any one who will deliver him to me, on my plantation in Halifax county, near Barksdale's Depot, on the Richmond and Danville railroad, or confine him in some county jail so that I can get him. He is about 5 feet 11 inches high, ginger-bread color, usually wears his hair plaited, and when not plaited has a full head of hair.
He was bought recently from Col. James W. Twyman, of Hadison county, Va, and it is believed he is making his way to his old neighborhood.
My post-office is Whitlook, Halifax, Va.

div3.head: Twenty-five Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway about one month last, a negro man, belonging to Mr, E. M. W named Albert.
Said negro is about 5 feet 9 or 10 inches high, of ginger-bread color, thin vorlage, somewhat abrupt in his answers; his front teeth decayed, and dresses well.
Said follow was hired to Mr. Worsham last year and to Mr. J. P. Ballard for a portion of this year, and no doubt has hired himself to one of the eating or sporting houses in this city.
We will give the above reward of $25 for the apprehension and delivery of said negro to us or confined in jail so that we get him again.

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from my residence, in Buckingham county, a negro man named Jim. He was purchased in Richmond, about a month or six weeks ago, at public auction.
He was brought from the neighborhood of Culpeper Court House, and it is thought he is endeavoring to return there by way of Richmond.
He is about 5 feet nearly 8 or 10 inches high, nearly white, and about 21 or 22 years old; had on when he left brown, home-made pants, wooden bottom shoes, gray military coat, (velvet collar, and brass buttons) and a gray slouched her, with wide band; he is a bricklayer and prisoner by trade.
If delivered in any jail where I can get him I will pay $10
My Post-Office is Buckingham Court House.
div3.closer:
R. W. Roseley. De 31--4t*
Charlottesville papers copy one week.

div3.p:
Twenty Dollars reward will be paid for the arrest of a bright mulatto Odell about 13 years old. She left my house at 9 o'clock Monday night, with no bo she wore a faded yellow calico dress and Virginia cloth apron, with long sleeves and body.
She was seen near 17th street and Mr. Snod residence on Tuesday morning. She is about 5 feet high, has good teeth, long, straight hair, and blue eyes.
I will give the above reward for her arrest, or any information so I can get her again.
div3.closer:
L. Powers,
Corner 19th and Venable sis. co 31--3t*

div3.head: Twenty-five Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from the subscriber, on the 12th of December, a negro man named Isham, complexion bright, five feet six inches high; two scare on his forehead; one by the side of his right eye. He has whiskers.
His clothiers, coat and vest, yellow, and overcoat brown, black hat, with crumpled brim.--When he left he took an axe with him, I think to pass himself off as a carpenter.
I purchased him in Richmond.
If put in jail address me at Drake's Breach, Charlotte county, Va.

div3.head:
Office Richmond & Petersburgs B. R. Co,
Richmond, Va, Nov, 7th, 1862.
div3.p:
Runaway — A suitable reward will be paid for the apprehension and delivery of a negro man named John, who was away from this company in October last.
John was hired from Mr. H. B. Hoopers, of Fredericksburg.

div3.head:
Tredegar Iron works.
Richmond, Nov. 28, 1863.
div3.p: Wanted--five hundred hands.--We wish to hire for the ensuring year five hundred able-bodied negro men, to be employed by on at our Blast Furnaces, in Botetourt country, and our Coal Mines, on James river, seventeen miles above this city.
As our works generally are remote from the nmy's lines, and the negroes are well guarded, we think it greatly for the interest of those having hands to dispose of to hire them to us.
The negroes will be supplied with the very provisions, which have already been secured, and good clothing provided from them at all seasons of the year.

Those of whom we have hands hired for the present year will please inform as whether we still retain those hands at the furnaces until they are re-hired; and if not to what point they shall be returned, as some of the owners may have changed their places of residence.
Payments for the hire of these hands will be made either at Farmville, Lynchburg or this city, annually or quarterly, at the option of the owner.

Applications can be made to F. T. Glasgow Pincas Wm. T. Patton, at Clover Dale Furnace; James L. Patton, at Grace Furnace; Wm. Jordan, Alum Springs; John H. Jamison.
Lynchburg; Benjamin Holladay.
Frederick's Hall, Louisa col;James M. Poindexter, Farmville, or the undersigned, at these works.

div3.head: Wanted — men.
div3.p: --Under authority to organize for the war the 25th Virginia Battalion, granted Major W. M. Bilictt by the Secretary of War, in Special Order No. 285, I desire to enlist a number of able bodied men, to complete the organization of my company.

The duty of said battalion is for local and special defence on the city of Richmond, and the perform such services as they may be ordered to perform within the circuit of the batteries around Richmond

div3.head: Wanted — Laborers.
div3.p:
--I wish to hire for the James River and Kanawha Company, a large force of negro Carpenters and Laborers, to work on the repairs of the Canal between this city and Lynchburg during the ensuing year.
The company will give similar wages to what other companies in this State may pay, and will feed, clothe, and pay all doctors' bills.
For any further information address the undersigned here; Messrs. Gray & Anderson at Lynchburg, or any one of the master mechanics or overseers located on the first division of the Canal.

div3.head: Wanted.
div3.p:
--I wish to hire for 1863 Fifty negro men for the surface and underground operations at the Carbon Hill Mines, in this county.
Also, good Carpenters and Smiths, and a few men to work at the Coke yards in this city.--dant provisions and good clothing will be furnished.

div3.head: Wanted
div3.p:
To purchase or hire, for the ensuing year, a No. 1 Cook; also, a Nurse 14.
A liberal price will be paid for those that will ull.

div3.head: Wanted to hire
div3.p:
--Immediately, thirty negroes, male or female, as Nurses in a Small box Hospital, Highest prices paid.
Apply to
div3.closer:
C. D. Rice.
Howard's Grove Hospital. de 27--10t*

div3.head: Wanted — to hire.
div3.p:
--For the ensuing year, a comptent female Servant, who is a good Clock, Weather, and Ironer.
For one what can came well recommended for competency and charter I will pay a liberal price.

div3.head: Wanted
div3.p:
To purchase or hire, a No. 1 Dining room Servant.
For a competent man for good character and habits, liberal price will he paid.

div3.head: Wanted.--Recruits.
div3.p:
--Wanted, for the Public Guard, of Richmond, several Recruits.
Apply at the Armory, corner 7th and Cary streets.

div3.head: Wanted
div3.p:
A large number of Servants.--made and female.--Also, an Assistant Matson.
Apply between the house of 12 and 1st 2d Alma Hospital, corner of Franklin 25th sts.

div3.head: Lost negro man found.
div3.p:
Davy, a tall black, negro man, with abort whiskers and moustache, and clothed in homespun about hall worn, was delivered to me for safekeeping by Conductor W. E. Taylor last Saturday week — Davy says be belongs to Joe Wright, of Pittsylvania county, about 30 miles from Danville, and was on his way to wait on his young master, who is a Lieutenant in Gen. Wise's Brigade.
The owner will please come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take his servant . Apply to
div3.closer:
F. J. Sampson, Gen'l Frl. Agt,
Richmond and Danville R. R.
Danville papers please copy and send bill to me immediately. de15--1m

div3.head:
Headq's Co. E. 10th Bat's Va. Art'y,
Battery no. 2 Richmond Defenses,
January 1st, 1863.
div3.p: Thirty Dollars reward will be paid for each of the following named deserters from my company, if delivered to me at Battery No. 2, or confined in Castle Thunder, Richmond:
Peter Clarke, aged 17, eyes blue, hair light, complexion dark, 5 feet 6 inches high, born in Ireland, by occupation a laborer.
Thomas Patton, aged 40, eyes gray, hair brown, complexion fair, height 5 feet 54 inches, born in Ireland by occupation a laborer.
James Mack, aged 45, eyes blue, hair dark, complexion dark, height 5 feet 2½ inches, born in Ireland, occupation a bricklayer.
George Camm, aged 47, eyes blue, hair light, complexion light, height 5 feet 8 inches, born in England, occupation a sailor.
Thomas Harrington, aged 46, eyes blue, hair light, complexion light, height 5 feet 7 inches, born in Ireland, occupation a laborer.
John Woodson, aged 45, eyes blue, hair dark, complexion dark, height 5 feet 6 inches, born in Ireland, occupation a laborer.
John Diller, aged 45, eyes gray, hair dark, complexion dark, height 6 feet, born in Louisiana, and by occupation a blacksmith.

div3.head: Thirty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Deserted from comp'y H. 15th Virginia reg't, Patrick Morrisay, about 36 years of age; six feet high; hazel eyes; sandy hair, and square shoulders.
Said Morrisay deserted on or about the 26th day of August last.
The above reward will be paid if delivered to me at camp, near Guines Station, on the R. F and F railroad.

All Absentees of company H, 15th Virginia reg't, are hereby ordered to report to me in person, or forward an army surgeon's certificate, within ten days after the publication of this notices, or be published as deserters, and treated as such.

div3.head:
Camp near Richmond,
December 29, 1862.
div3.p: Deserted--$30 reward.--The above reward will be paid for each of the following named men, who have deserted from the Alexandria Light Artillery:

Serg't Wm. Thompson, aged 23, 5 feet 6 inches high, dark gray eyes.
dark hair, ruddy complexion, and Roman nose.
Private Geo. F Elliott, aged 24, 5 feet 6 inches high, gray eyes, dark hair, and dark complexion.
Private Wm. Swartz, aged 25, 5 feet 5 inches high, blue eyes, light hair, and light complexion.
Private John Wood, aged 29, 5 feet 10 inches high, gray eyes, dark hair, and dark complexion.
Private Robt. Anderson, aged 22, 5 feet 5 inches high, gray eyes, sandy hair, and dark complexion.
Henry Lloyd, aged 23, light hair and light complexion.
Bernard Cline, aged 28, 5 feet 6 inches high, dark hair, gray eyes, and light complexion.
John Charlton, aged 28, 5 feet 8 inches high, dark hair, gray eyes, and light complexion.
Wm. Elliott, aged 30, 5 feet 7 inches high, blue eyes, sandy hair, and light complexion.
Henry Simpson, aged 24, 5 feet 11 inches high, gray eyes, and dark hair.
Jas. Tyler, aged 38, 5 feet 11 inches high, dark eyes, black hair, dark complexion, and four fingers of right hand have been cut off.
R Sweeney, aged 45, 5 feet 9½ inches high, gray eyes, dark hair, and dark complexion.
Thos. Owens, aged 46, 5 feet 6½ inches high, blue eyes, dark hair, and dark complexion.
Michael Conner, aged 46, 5 feet 6 inches high, dark eyes, dark hair, and dark complexion.

div3.head: Deserter.
div3.p:
--Deserted from Camp Randolph Grove, near Richmond, Nov. 10th, 1862.
Patrick Moran, a substitute for S. H. Lockett, of Macon (Ga.) Light Artillery, Col. Rhett comd'g.--Said Patrick Moran is an Irishman, and had a discharge from Wheat's battalion from Louisiana.
He is represented as being 46 years of age, about five feet nine inches high, light complexion, very freckled face, blue eyes.
A reward 30 will be paid for him by the Government and $25 extra by the Captain, if delivered to camp or in Castle Thunder.
I hear he is laying round the city in citizen's dress.
div3.closer:
H. N. Ells, Capt. Comd'g
Macon (Ga.) Light Artillery.
Camp near Richmond, Dec. 29, '62. ja 1--4t*

div3.head: Deserted--thirty Dollars reward
div3.p:
The above reward will be paid for each of the following named men, who have deserted from Company A, 53d Virginia reg't: John H Duke, Jno Dunnavant, John Foster, James Goodman, Claiborne Carter, Archer Jordan, Thos Jordan, George Jordan, Lewis Jacob, Jas Lawford, Patrick Mahoney, William E Pitts, Henderson Parker, Fielding Pollard, Richard Pollard, Wm Riley, James Ryan, Chas Smith, Richard Smool, Henry Southall, Richard Tucker, Albert C Turner, Jos Throckmorton, Richard Tenman, Gidwell Warner.
The above were originally members of company D. 5th; Virginia battalion, and are from in or about the city of Richmond.

Also, John Biser, who left this company on the night of the 12th of December, 1862 near the battle ground of Fredericksburg.
Said Bizer was a substitute, and formerly belonged to the Tiger Rifled, from New Orleans.
I will pay an additional reward of $50 for his apprehension and delivery to me.
Also, Obidiah Turner and Joseph Wray, from Franklin county, Va., who deserted at or near Falling Creek, on or about the 16th of July, 1862.
All other members of this company who are absent are required to report to me immediately, or they will be considered as deserters, and so advertised.
div3.closer:
Henry A. Edmondson,
Capt. Comp'y A, 53d Virginia reg't.
Camp near Fredericksburg, December 20, 1862. de 29--4t*

div4.p:
--At camp, near Richmond, Va., May 30th, 1862, John Walton, a substitute of Co. K, 12th Va Reg't. Said Walton professed to be an Englishman by birth.
He is about 35 years old, five feet eight inches high, dark complexion and dark hair.
Also, at camp, near Richmond, Va., Aug. 10th, 1862, a substitute, calling himself Geo. Fifer.
He is a German by birth, about five feet five inches high, fair complexion, light hair, speaks English badly, and is about 30 years old. A reward of $50 will be paid for the apprehension and delivery of either of the above deserters.
div4.closer:
J. H. Grinstead,
Lieut. Commanding Co. K, 19th Va. Reg't.
Camp near Fredericksburg, Va, Dec. 9.

div4.p: All Absentees from Co. K, 19th Va. Reg't, will report immediately, in person or by certificate from a Surgeon of the C. S. A., or be considered as deserters and no reported.
div4.closer:
By order of Henry Ganny, Lieut. Col. Commanding 19th Va. Reg't.
J. H. Chinstead,
Lt Com'g Co. K, 19th Va Reg't. de 17--10t*

div3.head: Ninety Dollars reward.
div3.p: --A reward of $30 each will be paid for the delivery to me, at Camp French, near Petersburg, Va., of the following men, who deserted from their company on the night of the 20th of December:
Tra G. Dobbs, aged about 30 years, 6 feet high, dark hair, dark blue eyes, dark complexion, and well built.
John L Shope, about 5 feet 7 inches high, light complexion, blue eyes, light hair, and stoutly built; rather hoarse voice.
Wm Shope, 5 feet 5 inches high, light hair, blue eyes, sallow complexion, very large month, and shuffling galt.
Tra G. Dobbs resides near Charlottesville, Va., and may probably be found in its vicinity.
John and Wm Shope may probably be found near Milton, Albemarle county, Va.

div3.head:
Hdq'rs Co. I, 59th Reg't Va. Vols.
Manchester, Dec'r 29, 1862.
div3.p:
Deserted--thirty Dollars reward.
The following named men are absentees from my company, now stationed in Manchester:
I will give the above reward for each of the above named men, if delivered to me in Manchester, or put in Castle Thunder, in Richmond, so that I can get them.

div3.head: Deserted
div3.p: --From my camp, at Varina, about the 5th of November, 1862:
Edgar J. Hinston, 36 years of age; 5 feet 10½ inches high; gray eyes; light brown hair; light complexion; was born in Ireland; is decent in appearance; has a youthful voice.
G. P. Dungan, 29 years of age; hazel eyes; dark hair; 5 feet 7½ inches high; enlisted in Westmoreland county, Va., by Capt. Sanford.
L. P. Newman, aged 21 years; blue eyes; light hair; dark complexion; 5 feet 7 inches high; enlisted in Richmond county, Va., by Lieut. Harwood.
J. H. Bryant, aged 26 years; gray eyes; light hair; dark complexion; 5 feet 5½ inches high; enlisted in Westmoreland county, Va., by Capt. Sandford.
R. W. Kelley, aged 18 years; hazel eyes; dark hair; dark complexion; 5 feet 4½ inches high; enlisted in Westmoreland county, Va., by Capt. Sandford.
A. S. King, aged 18 years, gray eyes; dark hair; dark complexion; 5 feet 6½ inches high; enlisted in Westmoreland county, Va., by Capt. Sandford.
Samuel French, aged 21 years; gray eyes; dark hair; dark complexion; 5 feet 6½ inches high; enlisted in Westmoreland county, Va, by Capt Sandford.
The above six men were conscripts, and deserted from my camp, at Varina, Nov'r 13, 1862.

Fred'k Schmieder, (conscript's substitute,) enlisted at Richmond city, Va., by Lieut.-Colonel J. C. Shields, aged about 35 years; hazel eyes; dark hair; dark complexion; 5 feet 9½ inches high; born in Germany; deserted from camp at Chaffin's farm, Nov'r 23, 1862.
A reward of $30 will be paid for the apprehension of each, if placed in jail, so that I get them.
div3.closer:
G. A. Wallace, Capt. Comp'y F,
59th Va. reg't, Wise Brigade. de9--ts

div3.p: Deserted from my Camp, at Chaffin's Farm Sunday night, Nov. 23d, 1862:
James Galvin, aged 28 years, 5 feet 7 inches high, brown eyes, dark hair, dark complexion, born in New York.
Patrick Golden, aged 28 years, 5 feet inches high, dark hazel eyes, dark brown hair, dark complexion, born in Ireland.
Thirty dollars reward will be paid for the apprehension of each and delivery to any C. S. prison
div3.closer:
G. A. Wallace, Capt. Co. I,
48th Va. reg't, Wise Brigade. no 27--ts

div3.head:
Hdq'rs 3d Virginia cavalry,
Caroline county, Va., December 20th, 1862.

div4.p: Special order no. --

The following officers, non-commissioned officers, and privates, of this regiment, having been reported to these headquarters as absent from their respective companies without authority, are hereby notified that if they do not return to their companies at the expiration of twelve days from the first publication of this order, or satisfactory account for their absence, their names will be published as deserters, and measures will be taken for their immediate arrest and trial before court-martial.
In cases of sickness nothing will be received as valid but a certificate from a Surgeon P. A. C. S.
div4.closer:
By order of Col. Thos. H. Owen.
H. S McCLELLAN, Adj't.

list.head: list:
list.item: Company A--Corporal R M Hite; privates Wm B Smith, Thos A Walker, S B Goods, and A M Brandy.
Company C--Privates A C Glenn, Wm Ellington, Wm Brewer, T F Hearst, Ryans, Lamberth, Sheridan, Pool, Shields, and A J Bass.
Company D--Lieut V Walker; private V J Mountcastle and W B Haynes.

Company F--Sergeants Gen W Tyree and Wm Christian; Corporals J R Bradenham and Wm A Hicks; privates R O Christian, Robert Bradley, M Sherman, J W Crump, T S Lacy, W W Jones, J P Meanley, Jas McKenzie, J P Timberlake, R S Taylor, G Vaiden, and Wm H Waring.

Company H--Private E L Allen, J Cage, E Cage, J D Cage, Gen Fisher, W E Jennings, W T Parker, Geo. R Roarke, F F Thornton, J W Walker, T H Walker, A J Hodges, M E West; Wm Hilliams is now published as a deserter.

Company I--Corporal T W Orgain; privates R G Bossier, E J Blankenship, R W Brown, T J Cairns, W D Connelly, John T Crittenden, W F Doyle, B W Foard, R Hill, W E Morris, R G Jackson, W H Jolly, H E Orgain, A M Orgain, G W Skinner, B H Spiers, T D Williams.
Company K--Privates C R Mosley and F J Perrick.

div3.head:
Headq'rs 5th La. Regiment,
Camp near Fredericksburg, Va.
div3.p: All absentees of this regiment will report immediately at these headquarters, unless they are on proper leave; falling to comply, they will be advertised as deserters in the face of the enemy, and treated as such.
div3.closer:
By order of
H. Ferno. Col. Comd'g. ja 2--3t*

div3.head: Substitute Wanted.
div3.p:
--An extremely liberal price will be paid for a reliable Substitute to go in some one of the batteries around Richmond, or into any company the substitute may desire.
Call at No. 181, up stairs, Main street, one door above Post-Office, Richmond, Va.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--Who can choose his own branch of service.
For one exempt from military duty, a liberal price will be paid.
Apply to McKINNEY & Dupuy, Shockoe Slip, to-day, from 9 till 3 o'clock.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted.
div3.p:
--Wanted, immediately, a Substitute, to take the place of a conscript.
$1,600 will be given for a man over 45 years of age. Address "H. L.," box 751, Richmond, Va.

div3.head: Two Substitute Wanted.
div3.p: --I wish to employ two Substitutes, men of good moral character, and over 45 years of age. Apply to "W. L. W.," at the office of Barksdale & Bro., corner of Virginia and Cary sts.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--A man to go in one of the batteries near the city.
He must be exempt from military duty.
I will give $150 in gold and $250 in current funds.
Apply to "A. B.," at the office of Thos. J. Bagby, No. 8 Wall street.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted.
div3.p: --A reliable man, over 45 years of age, and of good moral character, will hear of a good place in the army by applying immediately to
div3.closer:
D. Parr & Sons,
Corner Cary and 12th sts. de 19--4t*

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--One who is over 45 years of age, and not subject to conscript; must be of good moral character.
Will pay liberally.--Call at No. 25 Main st.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p: --Corner of Main and Jefferson Ward, opposite St. Charles Hotel.--A liberal price will be paid, if over 45 years old.--Apply forthwith.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--One of good moral character, for Cavalry service.
Apply at No. 101 Main st.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--A fair price will be paid for a Substitute, well recommended.
Apply to M. Harris, No. 10 Main street, between 17th and 18th. Call immediately, as a high price will be paid for one that suits.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--To go in a company in the 11th Virginia regiment, in Longstreet's corps, now stationed near Fredericksburg.
A liberal price will be paid for one who is over 45 years old, and can come well recommended.
Call at 199 Broad street, near 5th.

div3.head: Substitute Wanted
div3.p:
--For a member of the 15th Virginia Regiment.
For a reliable man a liberal price will be paid.
Apply at the office of the High Constable.
